trans-unit.source: Partition and Sample
trans-unit.target: Partition and Sample

trans-unit.source: Creates multiple partitions of a dataset based on sampling
trans-unit.target: Creates multiple partitions of a dataset based on sampling

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="73A66797-D6E4-48A1-98C1-2D764EC5D2CD" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data Transformation / Sample and Split</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="73A66797-D6E4-48A1-98C1-2D764EC5D2CD" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data Transformation / Sample and Split</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Partition and Sample</ui> module to perform sampling on a dataset or to create partitions from your dataset.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Partition and Sample</ui> module to perform sampling on a dataset or to create partitions from your dataset.

trans-unit.source: Sampling is an important tool in machine learning because it lets you reduce the size of a dataset while maintaining the same ratio of values.
trans-unit.target: Sampling is an important tool in machine learning because it lets you reduce the size of a dataset while maintaining the same ratio of values.

trans-unit.source: This module supports several important scenarios, such as:
trans-unit.target: This module supports several important scenarios, such as:

trans-unit.source: You want to divide your data into multiple subsections of the same size.
trans-unit.target: You want to divide your data into multiple subsections of the same size.

trans-unit.source: The goal might be to use the partitions for cross-validation or to assign cases to random groups.
trans-unit.target: The goal might be to use the partitions for cross-validation or to assign cases to random groups.

trans-unit.source: You want to work with data from only one partition.
trans-unit.target: You want to work with data from only one partition.

trans-unit.source: Let’s say you randomly assigned users to different groups, and then you want to modify the features that are associated with only one group.
trans-unit.target: Let’s say you randomly assigned users to different groups, and then you want to modify the features that are associated with only one group.

trans-unit.source: By choosing a fold, you can work with a selected subset of data without creating a separate dataset.
trans-unit.target: By choosing a fold, you can work with a selected subset of data without creating a separate dataset.

trans-unit.source: For sampling, you can extract a percentage of the data, apply random sampling, or choose a column to use for balancing the dataset and perform stratified sampling on its values.
trans-unit.target: For sampling, you can extract a percentage of the data, apply random sampling, or choose a column to use for balancing the dataset and perform stratified sampling on its values.

trans-unit.source: You want to get only the first <legacyItalic>n</legacyItalic> rows.
trans-unit.target: You want to get only the first <legacyItalic>n</legacyItalic> rows.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure Partition and Sample
trans-unit.target: How to Configure Partition and Sample

trans-unit.source: Add the <ui>Partition and Sample</ui> module to your experiment, and connect the dataset to the input.
trans-unit.target: Add the <ui>Partition and Sample</ui> module to your experiment, and connect the dataset to the input.

trans-unit.source: Select an option from the <ui>Partition or sample mode</ui> list.
trans-unit.target: Select an option from the <ui>Partition or sample mode</ui> list.

trans-unit.source: This option determines which type of partition you will create, or the type of sampling to use.
trans-unit.target: This option determines which type of partition you will create, or the type of sampling to use.

trans-unit.source: The available modes are:
trans-unit.target: The available modes are:

trans-unit.source: Assign to Folds
trans-unit.target: Assign to Folds

trans-unit.source: Use this mode when you want to divide the dataset into subsets of the data.
trans-unit.target: Use this mode when you want to divide the dataset into subsets of the data.

trans-unit.source: This mode is useful if you want to create a custom number of folds for cross-validation or if you want to split rows into several groups.
trans-unit.target: This mode is useful if you want to create a custom number of folds for cross-validation or if you want to split rows into several groups.

trans-unit.source: Pick Fold
trans-unit.target: Pick Fold

trans-unit.source: This mode lets you select data from a previously specified partition of a dataset.
trans-unit.target: This mode lets you select data from a previously specified partition of a dataset.

trans-unit.source: Sampling
trans-unit.target: Sampling

trans-unit.source: With this mode, you can perform simple random sampling or stratified random sampling.
trans-unit.target: With this mode, you can perform simple random sampling or stratified random sampling.

trans-unit.source: This mode is useful if you want to create a smaller representative sample dataset for testing.
trans-unit.target: This mode is useful if you want to create a smaller representative sample dataset for testing.

trans-unit.source: Head
trans-unit.target: Head

trans-unit.source: Use this mode to get only the first <legacyItalic>n</legacyItalic> rows.
trans-unit.target: Use this mode to get only the first <legacyItalic>n</legacyItalic> rows.

trans-unit.source: This option is useful for getting just some rows from a dataset, without requiring that they be balanced or sampled in any way.
trans-unit.target: This option is useful for getting just some rows from a dataset, without requiring that they be balanced or sampled in any way.

trans-unit.source: Based on the mode you selected, set other required parameters.
trans-unit.target: Based on the mode you selected, set other required parameters.

trans-unit.source: See the options section for details.
trans-unit.target: See the options section for details.

trans-unit.source: Run the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Run the experiment.

trans-unit.source: Assign to Folds Options
trans-unit.target: Assign to Folds Options

trans-unit.source: Define the folds to create by using the following options:
trans-unit.target: Define the folds to create by using the following options:

trans-unit.source: Use replacement in the partitioning
trans-unit.target: Use replacement in the partitioning

trans-unit.source: If you use replacement, the sampled row is put back into the pool of rows for potential reuse.
trans-unit.target: If you use replacement, the sampled row is put back into the pool of rows for potential reuse.

trans-unit.source: As a result, the same row might be assigned to several folds.
trans-unit.target: As a result, the same row might be assigned to several folds.

trans-unit.source: Without replacement (the default option), the sampled row is not put back into the pool of rows for potential reuse.
trans-unit.target: Without replacement (the default option), the sampled row is not put back into the pool of rows for potential reuse.

trans-unit.source: As a result, each row will be assigned to exactly one fold.
trans-unit.target: As a result, each row will be assigned to exactly one fold.

trans-unit.source: Randomized split
trans-unit.target: Randomized split

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you want rows to be randomly chosen.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you want rows to be randomly chosen.

trans-unit.source: Random seed
trans-unit.target: Random seed

trans-unit.source: Specify a seed value if you want the rows to be divided the same way every time.
trans-unit.target: Specify a seed value if you want the rows to be divided the same way every time.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the default value of 0 means that a random starting seed will be used.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the default value of 0 means that a random starting seed will be used.

trans-unit.source: Specify the partitioner method
trans-unit.target: Specify the partitioner method

trans-unit.source: Two methods are available to apportion data into the partitions:
trans-unit.target: Two methods are available to apportion data into the partitions:

trans-unit.source: Partition evenly
trans-unit.target: Partition evenly

trans-unit.source: If you select this option, an equal number of rows are assigned to each partition.
trans-unit.target: If you select this option, an equal number of rows are assigned to each partition.

trans-unit.source: Type the number of output partitions you want in the <ui>Specify number of folds to split evenly into</ui> text box.
trans-unit.target: Type the number of output partitions you want in the <ui>Specify number of folds to split evenly into</ui> text box.

trans-unit.source: Partition with customized proportions
trans-unit.target: Partition with customized proportions

trans-unit.source: If you use this option, you must specify a comma-separated list of partitions by their sizes.
trans-unit.target: If you use this option, you must specify a comma-separated list of partitions by their sizes.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to create three partitions, with the first partition containing 50% of the data, and the remaining two partitions each containing 25% of the data, you would enter the following numbers in the <ui>List of proportions separated by comma</ui> text box:
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to create three partitions, with the first partition containing 50% of the data, and the remaining two partitions each containing 25% of the data, you would enter the following numbers in the <ui>List of proportions separated by comma</ui> text box:

trans-unit.source: Stratified split for sampling
trans-unit.target: Stratified split for sampling

trans-unit.source: Regardless of whether you specify a custom ratio or you apportion rows equally, you can additionally specify that the rows be stratified when split.
trans-unit.target: Regardless of whether you specify a custom ratio or you apportion rows equally, you can additionally specify that the rows be stratified when split.

trans-unit.source: If you choose this option, you must select a strata column.
trans-unit.target: If you choose this option, you must select a strata column.

trans-unit.source: For more information about stratified sampling, see the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_StratifiedSampling" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section.
trans-unit.target: For more information about stratified sampling, see the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_StratifiedSampling" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section.

trans-unit.source: Pick Fold Options
trans-unit.target: Pick Fold Options

trans-unit.source: The following options are available to work with a previously specified fold, or partition:
trans-unit.target: The following options are available to work with a previously specified fold, or partition:

trans-unit.source: Specify which fold to be sampled from
trans-unit.target: Specify which fold to be sampled from

trans-unit.source: Choose a partition byspecifying its index, counted from one.
trans-unit.target: Choose a partition byspecifying its index, counted from one.

trans-unit.source: Pick complement of the selected fold
trans-unit.target: Pick complement of the selected fold

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you want to work with all data except that in the specified fold.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you want to work with all data except that in the specified fold.

trans-unit.source: The sample experiment, <externalLink><linkText>Split Partition and Sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525948</linkUri></externalLink>, demonstrates this technique.
trans-unit.target: The sample experiment, <externalLink><linkText>Split Partition and Sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525948</linkUri></externalLink>, demonstrates this technique.

trans-unit.source: For example, in the experiment, multiple instances of the module are used to partition and sample the data.
trans-unit.target: For example, in the experiment, multiple instances of the module are used to partition and sample the data.

trans-unit.source: First, the <ui>Assign to Folds</ui> option is used to assign rows in the dataset to one of three evenly sized groups.
trans-unit.target: First, the <ui>Assign to Folds</ui> option is used to assign rows in the dataset to one of three evenly sized groups.

trans-unit.source: Then, three more instances of <link xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Partition and Sample</link> are added by using the <ui>Pick Fold</ui> mode to apply operations to subsets of the data:
trans-unit.target: Then, three more instances of <link xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Partition and Sample</link> are added by using the <ui>Pick Fold</ui> mode to apply operations to subsets of the data:

trans-unit.source: For the first fold (index of 1), rows are split randomly.
trans-unit.target: For the first fold (index of 1), rows are split randomly.

trans-unit.source: For the second fold (index of 2), rows are split by education.
trans-unit.target: For the second fold (index of 2), rows are split by education.

trans-unit.source: For the third fold (index of 3), rows are split by age.
trans-unit.target: For the third fold (index of 3), rows are split by age.

trans-unit.source: Sampling Options
trans-unit.target: Sampling Options

trans-unit.source: The following options are available to customize the way that the dataset is sampled:
trans-unit.target: The following options are available to customize the way that the dataset is sampled:

trans-unit.source: Rate of sampling
trans-unit.target: Rate of sampling

trans-unit.source: The rate of sampling determines the percentage of rows from the source dataset that should be included in the output dataset.
trans-unit.target: The rate of sampling determines the percentage of rows from the source dataset that should be included in the output dataset.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you wanted only half of the original sample, you could type <userInput>0.5</userInput> to indicate that the sampling rate should be 50%.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you wanted only half of the original sample, you could type <userInput>0.5</userInput> to indicate that the sampling rate should be 50%.

trans-unit.source: The rows of the input dataset are shuffled and selectively put into the output dataset, according to the specified ratio.
trans-unit.target: The rows of the input dataset are shuffled and selectively put into the output dataset, according to the specified ratio.

trans-unit.source: Random seed for sampling
trans-unit.target: Random seed for sampling

trans-unit.source: Specify a seed value if you want the rows to be divided the same way every time.
trans-unit.target: Specify a seed value if you want the rows to be divided the same way every time.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the default value of 0 means that a random starting seed will be used.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the default value of 0 means that a random starting seed will be used.

trans-unit.source: Stratified split for sampling
trans-unit.target: Stratified split for sampling

trans-unit.source: This option determines whether the rows should be sampled in such a way that one set of values (from a column you select) should be evenly apportioned among the outputs.
trans-unit.target: This option determines whether the rows should be sampled in such a way that one set of values (from a column you select) should be evenly apportioned among the outputs.

trans-unit.source: If the sampling is stratified, the rows are apportioned as follows:
trans-unit.target: If the sampling is stratified, the rows are apportioned as follows:

trans-unit.source: All the input rows are grouped (stratified) by the values in the strata column.
trans-unit.target: All the input rows are grouped (stratified) by the values in the strata column.

trans-unit.source: Rows are shuffled within each group.
trans-unit.target: Rows are shuffled within each group.

trans-unit.source: Each group is selectively added to the output dataset to meet the specified ratio.
trans-unit.target: Each group is selectively added to the output dataset to meet the specified ratio.

trans-unit.source: For more information about stratified sampling, see the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_StratifiedSampling" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section.
trans-unit.target: For more information about stratified sampling, see the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_StratifiedSampling" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section.

trans-unit.source: Head Options
trans-unit.target: Head Options

trans-unit.source: Number of rows to select
trans-unit.target: Number of rows to select

trans-unit.source: Type a value as <math>n</math>, to get only the first <legacyItalic>n</legacyItalic> rows from the dataset.
trans-unit.target: Type a value as <math>n</math>, to get only the first <legacyItalic>n</legacyItalic> rows from the dataset.

trans-unit.source: The number of rows you specify must be a non-negative integer.
trans-unit.target: The number of rows you specify must be a non-negative integer.

trans-unit.source: If the number of selected rows is larger than the number of rows in the dataset then the entire dataset is returned.
trans-unit.target: If the number of selected rows is larger than the number of rows in the dataset then the entire dataset is returned.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: You can see examples of how this module is used by exploring these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: You can see examples of how this module is used by exploring these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: In the sample, <externalLink><linkText>Cross Validation for Binary Classification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525734</linkUri></externalLink>, a 20% sampling rate is applied to create a smaller randomly sampled dataset.
trans-unit.target: In the sample, <externalLink><linkText>Cross Validation for Binary Classification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525734</linkUri></externalLink>, a 20% sampling rate is applied to create a smaller randomly sampled dataset.

trans-unit.source: (The original census dataset had over 30,000 rows; the training dataset has around 6500.)
trans-unit.target: (The original census dataset had over 30,000 rows; the training dataset has around 6500.)

trans-unit.source: In the sample, <externalLink><linkText>Cross Validation for Regression</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525735</linkUri></externalLink>, the data is randomly and evenly assigned to five folds (with no stratification), and the results are used for cross-validation.
trans-unit.target: In the sample, <externalLink><linkText>Cross Validation for Regression</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525735</linkUri></externalLink>, the data is randomly and evenly assigned to five folds (with no stratification), and the results are used for cross-validation.

trans-unit.source: The sample, <externalLink><linkText>Split Partition and Sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525948</linkUri></externalLink>, demonstrates multiple ways to use partitioning and sampling.
trans-unit.target: The sample, <externalLink><linkText>Split Partition and Sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525948</linkUri></externalLink>, demonstrates multiple ways to use partitioning and sampling.

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: This module can work with data in any column that is nominal or categorical.
trans-unit.target: This module can work with data in any column that is nominal or categorical.

trans-unit.source: The module assumes that the specified strata column has a finite set of possible values.
trans-unit.target: The module assumes that the specified strata column has a finite set of possible values.

trans-unit.source: For instance, if the specified strata column has floating point values (and hence potentially infinite values) and the data attribute's metadata type is not categorical, this module will return an error.
trans-unit.target: For instance, if the specified strata column has floating point values (and hence potentially infinite values) and the data attribute's metadata type is not categorical, this module will return an error.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the strata column you specify does not have continuous data (that is, numerical data with floating point values in each cell).
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the strata column you specify does not have continuous data (that is, numerical data with floating point values in each cell).

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the module will not complete its processing.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the module will not complete its processing.

trans-unit.source: If the strata column contains Boolean values and you want them to be interpreted as categorical, you must use the <link xlink:href="370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link> module to change the metadata label.
trans-unit.target: If the strata column contains Boolean values and you want them to be interpreted as categorical, you must use the <link xlink:href="370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link> module to change the metadata label.

trans-unit.source: More about Stratified Sampling
trans-unit.target: More about Stratified Sampling

trans-unit.source: Stratified sampling ensures that subsets of the data have a representative sampling of the selected strata column.
trans-unit.target: Stratified sampling ensures that subsets of the data have a representative sampling of the selected strata column.

trans-unit.source: This technique is useful, for example, when you want to ensure that your training data contains the same distribution of age values that the test data has or vice versa.
trans-unit.target: This technique is useful, for example, when you want to ensure that your training data contains the same distribution of age values that the test data has or vice versa.

trans-unit.source: Or you might want to stratify a gender column in a health-care study to ensure that males and females are distributed evenly when the data is partitioned.
trans-unit.target: Or you might want to stratify a gender column in a health-care study to ensure that males and females are distributed evenly when the data is partitioned.

trans-unit.source: Stratification ensures that the ratios of the selected values are preserved.
trans-unit.target: Stratification ensures that the ratios of the selected values are preserved.

trans-unit.source: You specify values on which to separate the data by selecting a single column to serve as the <newTerm>strata column</newTerm>.
trans-unit.target: You specify values on which to separate the data by selecting a single column to serve as the <newTerm>strata column</newTerm>.

trans-unit.source: This module requires that the strata column is a categorical column with discrete values.
trans-unit.target: This module requires that the strata column is a categorical column with discrete values.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use a column of integer values for the strata, it is a best practice to assign a categorical type to this column.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use a column of integer values for the strata, it is a best practice to assign a categorical type to this column.

trans-unit.source: You can do this through the schema of the data before you add it to Azure Machine Learning Studio, or you can updated the column’s metadata by using <link xlink:href="370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link>.
trans-unit.target: You can do this through the schema of the data before you add it to Azure Machine Learning Studio, or you can updated the column’s metadata by using <link xlink:href="370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link>.

trans-unit.source: Columns with continuous data (that is, numerical data with floating point values in each cell) cannot be used as strata columns.
trans-unit.target: Columns with continuous data (that is, numerical data with floating point values in each cell) cannot be used as strata columns.

trans-unit.source: If the specified strata column has floating point values and the metadata type of the data attribute is not categorical, the module will return an error message and fail to process the data.
trans-unit.target: If the specified strata column has floating point values and the metadata type of the data attribute is not categorical, the module will return an error message and fail to process the data.

trans-unit.source: If the column you want to use as the strata column has any numeric or Boolean values, use <link xlink:href="370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link> to guarantee that the column will be treated as categorical.
trans-unit.target: If the column you want to use as the strata column has any numeric or Boolean values, use <link xlink:href="370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link> to guarantee that the column will be treated as categorical.

trans-unit.source: If your strata column contains string or numerical data with too many unique values, the column is not a good candidate for stratified sampling.
trans-unit.target: If your strata column contains string or numerical data with too many unique values, the column is not a good candidate for stratified sampling.
